00057 bool EGS_EXPORT egsStoreI64(ostream &data, EGS_I64 n) {
00058     EGS_I64 i1 = n;
00059     i1 /= 1000000000;
00060     EGS_I64 i2 = n % 1000000000;
00061     data << " " << (int) i1 << " " << (int) i2;
00062     if (data.fail()) {
00063         return false;
00064     }
00065     return true;
00066 }
00067 
00068 bool EGS_EXPORT egsGetI64(istream &data, EGS_I64 &n) {
00069     int i1, i2;
00070     data >> i1 >> i2;
00071     if (data.eof() || !data.good()) {
00072         return false;
00073     }
00074     n = i1;
00075     n *= 1000000000;
00076     n += i2;
00077     return true;
00078 }

00080 static FILE *egs_info_fp = stdout;
00081 static FILE *egs_warning_fp = stderr;
00082 static FILE *egs_error_fp = stderr;
00083 
00084 static EGS_LOCAL char __egsf_write_buf[8192];
00085 
00086 static void EGS_LOCAL __egs_default_information(const char *msg, ...) {
00087     va_list ap;
00088     va_start(ap, msg);
00089     EGS_Application *a = EGS_Application::activeApplication();
00090     if (a) {
00091         vsprintf(__egsf_write_buf,msg,ap);
00092         a->appInformation(__egsf_write_buf);
00093     }
00094     else {
00095         vfprintf(egs_info_fp, msg, ap);
00096         fflush(egs_info_fp);
00097     }
00098     va_end(ap);
00099 }
00100 
00101 static void EGS_LOCAL __egs_default_warning(const char *msg, ...) {
00102     va_list ap;
00103     va_start(ap, msg);
00104     EGS_Application *a = EGS_Application::activeApplication();
00105     if (a) {
00106         vsprintf(__egsf_write_buf,msg,ap);
00107         a->appWarning(__egsf_write_buf);
00108     }
00109     else {
00110 
00111         vfprintf(egs_warning_fp, msg, ap);
00112         fflush(egs_warning_fp);
00113     }
00114     va_end(ap);
00115 }
00116 
00117 static void EGS_LOCAL __egs_default_error(const char *msg, ...) {
00118     va_list ap;
00119     va_start(ap, msg);
00120     EGS_Application *a = EGS_Application::activeApplication();
00121     if (a) {
00122         vsprintf(__egsf_write_buf,msg,ap);
00123         va_end(ap);
00124         a->appFatal(__egsf_write_buf);
00125     }
00126     else {
00127         vfprintf(egs_error_fp, msg, ap);
00128         fflush(stderr);
00129         va_end(ap);
00130         exit(1);
00131     }
00132 }

00134 EGS_InfoFunction EGS_EXPORT egsInformation = __egs_default_information;
00135 EGS_InfoFunction EGS_EXPORT egsWarning = __egs_default_warning;
00136 EGS_InfoFunction EGS_EXPORT egsFatal = __egs_default_error;
00137 
00138 EGS_InfoFunction egsSetInfoFunction(EGS_InfoType t, EGS_InfoFunction func) {
00139     if (!func) {
00140         egsWarning("egsSetInfoFunction: info function can not be NULL!\n");
00141         return 0;
00142     }
00143     EGS_InfoFunction res;
00144     switch (t) {
00145     case Information:
00146         res = egsInformation;
00147         egsInformation = func;
00148         break;
00149     case Warning:
00150         res = egsWarning;
00151         egsWarning = func;
00152         break;
00153     case Fatal:
00154         res = egsFatal;
00155         egsFatal = func;
00156         break;
00157     default:
00158         egsWarning("Unknown info function type\n");
00159         res = 0;
00160     }
00161     return res;
00162 }
00163 
00164 void egsSetDefaultIOFunctions() {
00165     egsInformation = __egs_default_information;
00166     egsWarning = __egs_default_warning;
00167     egsFatal = __egs_default_error;
00168 }

00170 template <class T> void __egs_swap_bytes(T *v) {
00171     char *c = (char *) v;
00172     char tmp = c[0];
00173     c[0]=c[3];
00174     c[3]=tmp;
00175     tmp = c[1];
00176     c[1]=c[2];
00177     c[2]=tmp;
00178 }
00179 
00180 void egsSwapBytes(int *n) {
00181     __egs_swap_bytes<int>(n);
00182 }
00183 void egsSwapBytes(float *n) {
00184     __egs_swap_bytes<float>(n);
00185 }
00186 
00187 void egsSwapBytes(short *n) {
00188     char *c = (char *) n;
00189     char tmp=c[0];
00190     c[0]=c[1];
00191     c[1]=tmp;
00192 }

00194 string egsJoinPath(const string &first, const string &second) {
00195     int n = first.size()-1;
00196     char c = first[n];
00197     string result(first);
00198     if (c == '/' && c != __egs_fs) {
00199         result[n] = __egs_fs;
00200     }
00201     if (result[n] != __egs_fs) {
00202         result += __egs_fs;
00203     }
00204     result += second;
00205     return result;
00206 }
00207 
00208 string egsStripPath(const string &aname) {
00209     int j;
00210     for (j=aname.size()-1; j>=0; j--) {
00211         if (aname[j] == '/' || aname[j] == __egs_fs) {
00212             j++;
00213             break;
00214         }
00215     }
00216     if (j < 0) {
00217         return aname;
00218     }
00219     string result;
00220     if (j >= 0) {
00221         while (j < aname.size()) {
00222             result += aname[j++];
00223         }
00224     }
00225     return result;
00226 }

00235 string egsHostName() {
00236 #ifdef WIN32
00237     // Windows has the gethostname() function but it only works after
00238     // calling WSAStartup and in addition we have to link against the
00239     // ws2_32 DLL. This is pretty stupid as we just want to get the host name =>
00240     // we try to get the host name from environment variables.
00241     char *var = getenv("COMPUTERNAME");
00242     if (!var) {
00243         var = getenv("HOSTNAME");
00244         if (!var) {
00245             var = getenv("HOST");
00246         }
00247     }
00248     if (!var) {
00249         return "unknown";
00250     }
00251     return var;
00252 #else
00253     char buf[1024];
00254     int err = gethostname(buf,1023);
00255     if (err) {
00256         return "unknown";
00257     }
00258     return buf;
00259 #endif
00260 }

00262 int egsGetPid() {
00263 #ifdef WIN32
00264     return _getpid();
00265 #else
00266     return getpid();
00267 #endif
00268 }

00270 string egsSimplifyCVSKey(const string &key) {
00271     if (key.size() < 2) {
00272         return key;
00273     }
00274     int js;
00275     for (js=0; js<key.size(); js++) if (key[js] == '$') {
00276             break;
00277         }
00278     if (js >= key.size()) {
00279         return key;
00280     }
00281     int je;
00282     for (je=key.size()-1; je>=0; je--) if (key[je] == '$') {
00283             break;
00284         }
00285     if (je <= js) {
00286         return key;
00287     }
00288     string result;
00289     for (int j=js+1; j<je; j++) {
00290         result += key[j];
00291     }
00292     return result;
00293 }
00294 
00295 int egsGetEndian() {
00296     int nl = 0x12345678;
00297     unsigned char *p = (unsigned char *)(&nl);
00298     if (p[0] == 0x12 && p[1] == 0x34 && p[2] == 0x56 && p[3] == 0x78) {
00299         return 0;
00300     }
00301     if (p[0] == 0x78 && p[1] == 0x56 && p[2] == 0x34 && p[3] == 0x12) {
00302         return 1;
00303     }
00304     return -1;
00305 }
00306 
00307 bool egsIsAbsolutePath(const string &path) {
00308 #ifdef WIN32
00309     if (path.size() < 2) {
00310         return false;
00311     }
00312     if ((path[0] == '/' || path[0] == __egs_fs) &&
00313             (path[1] == '/' || path[1] == __egs_fs)) {
00314         return true;
00315     }
00316     if (path.size() < 3) {
00317         return false;
00318     }
00319     if (!isalpha(path[0])) {
00320         return false;
00321     }
00322     if (path[1] != ':') {
00323         return false;
00324     }
00325     if (path[2] != '/' && path[2] != __egs_fs) {
00326         return false;
00327     }
00328     return true;
00329 #else
00330     return (path[0] == '/');
00331 #endif
00332 }
